comment: It's pretty clear he doesn't really understand the course material and is just pulling stuff from random YouTube videos.
Awful!!!! Does not explain in a way you can understand. When questions are asked for clarification, they are never answered just walked around.

Not very engaging for lectures even in person; lectures for this class often had wrong information especially in calculations for example problems. Quizzes & exams were very similar to homework and lecture problems. Quiz & exams also were multiple choice, so no partial credit or feedback on your work.
Super nice guy and replies to his emails within literal hours. Super helpful and his classes were extremely straightforward as long as you did the HW. Had a textbook but we never even used it

He is a strong minded person when you ask him something about the class be specific and straight froward, He definitely explain the material pretty fast and if u did not understand at first I recommend you to raise your hand as soon as possible because he do not explain for a secnd time maybe till the nxt meting day at the beginning of next lesson.

He pretty much just made up his own accounting standards and was very unclear. Sometimes he would scream at people in my class. Honestly probably the funniest class I've taken just cause it was so crazy. Tests were pretty joke and I got an A.

I took him for civil graphics and his class was not hard whatsoever. He does go a little fast but everything is pretty logical. If I had any questions I would always email him and/or set up a time for him to clear something up. 
He will assign an easy class assignment that is due the same night given. Tests are not hard either. He is chill.

By far the worst professor Ive had at KSU. Had him twice and both times were a waste of time and money. Not hard courses but youll leave knowing no more than you did before. Doesnt know what hes assigning so has virtually no help with homeworks and projects.

Avoid this professor. Hw and in class assignments are a completion grade. Extra credit counts for 5 points on your exams. Shows up 10 min late to class every time (including exams). hard to understand, only took him bc he was last option. open note on exams bc of lack of teaching ability.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor is very caring and lenient when it comes to grading and due dates. Each class day we receive class work to do which is due the same day, every often we receive homework with one week to complete, and three tests of drawings. Sounds like a lot but manageable. He will always answer your question, in person or online any time.

He has a very monotonic voice. Overall he is a great guy and grades very leniently. Most of the class assignments he does in class with you after. He also records the lecture if you want to look at it later on. The only negative thing I would say is that he does teach very fast. So you could fall behind easily.

Negatives: Disorganized (never knows where the last class left off), often late to class, blames students for topics he forgets to cover, tough grader, sometimes tests on materials not covered in class (and then blames students), gives homework he doesn't understand/know how to solve

Positives: Repeats certain topics that students struggle with

He refused to grade anything you did or give feedback. he arbitrarily gives out grades after the end of the semester. not even worth nothing to try. if you contact him he will not answer your questions

I took this class as a hybrid course. One day of the week was in person while the other was online. All lectures were recorded on teams. He has the most atrocious writing I've seen but he'll make sure you understand if you ask. The homework load was light and class assignments added 20 points to exams if done. The exams were open note and open book
Terrible Teacher who doesn't care about students learning.  I wish you could avoid him but he's the only one who teaches this class. He should quit teaching!
Dr Shirazinejab is a very laid back prof. took him for fluid lab and was super easy. take him, your gpa will thank you. Also this lab is mostly group work so your group also matters
Very sweet professor, if you have problems he will help 9 times out of 10, and is not afraid to acknowledge mistakes
Doesn't communicate with students, is extremely disorganized, and gives poor explanations. Super slow at grading
Literally the most ridiculous instructor - A serious headache

It's not worth your money. He chooses presentations from others on the internet. The classes are very short. All he does is reads the slides. You are learning at home and paying for the degree. 1 is too much he is a 0.
His lectures are terrible, but he needs a bit more knowledge about the class materials.
He is an awful teacher. Those good feedback you see in this site he has written for himself.

Far most easiest A on my lab. so far. Lab requirements were not too hard. And for exam, all we used was an excel file that we put in the lab. I am not sure about other classes but for 3345 lab or any other lab, you can't be wrong by taking him. it was a group lab. definitely recommended for the lab.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: i took him for fluids lab. the lab reports were broken into two groups with 7 people in a group. he graded the labs based on completing what he wanted not accuracy. watch the videos he posts so you know what he wants in the report. midterm and final are open book. easy grader on the labs, lowest grade we got was a 92. if you want an easy A take him

His straight forwardness could potentially be seen as rude. However, everything that he goes over in class is on the test. Him being straight forward should tell you that if he says something it means something, for you shouldnt over look anything. Very easy class as long as you participate and ask questions as soon as you miss something. Fair man
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: for civil graphics i think he is a good choice. not sure about the other courses he teaches, seems like people don't like him. all quizzes in the class are bonus points. tests are easy. homework is pretty easy. takes attendance. class assignments are participation graded. teaches too fast sometimes, but goes back if needed. if you show up easy A.
He doesnt do well explaining things but he tries his best to go over things for example when we are working with AutoCAD or civil3d he does the process again so you can see what you did wrong.
He has no background knowledge in engineering. My interpretation is that he is not qualify to teach the subject and he is nothing but a time waster.
Worse teacher in the civil engineering department, avoid at all cost

Take another professor if possible. You are going to have come to his class because he does take attendance then have to teach your self everything in greater depth because his tests only loosely resemble anything in class. His power points were more useful when learning the subject than he was. He knows his stuff he just doesn't know how to teach.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I truly can't imagine why anyone would give him a low rating. I'll agree sometimes his examples on the board can be confusing, but he'll take his time answering any question if you don't understand anything about it, you can tell that he genuinely cares about his students doing well which is more than I can say for most. Makes this class real easy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hard to understand, confusing material, hard to get a hold of, and made material boring and harder than it was. He has a lack of knowledge and lack of character.

In the fluid lab, he is so easy and generous at grading. (not tough grader at all). Very respected and a nice guy. for the mid-term and final try to study the previous exams in the previous semesters, they often are the same.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Stay away from this professor at all costs. He is by the worst teacher I have ever taken. He absolutely can not teach the content he is supposed to. Most of the lectures he writes down the answers for different examples and doesnt correct himself. He changes the variables during the lecture and doesnt explain why. He is terrible.
He is Very unorganized, doesn't like when people ask questions and even if he answers a questions doesn't really explain anything.

ok yeah it is not that great class and kinda boring but I gotta say he was generous at grading. The statics is an easy class but during the class you can see he is doing his best to explain the subject for you. Hw, Exams(2 exams) , QUIZES, and final each worth 20%. Given extra points for attendance at the end of semester and allow sheets in tests.

Very unclear grading criteria and curriculum goals. We took a department-standardized final at the end of class and nobody had even seen about a quarter of it. Grading was sporadic, even as far as identical homework assignments being multiple letter grades apart. Lectures were tricky to follow, as they didn't coordinate with his power points.

He understands the material but he does not know how to explain anything. He can get mad if you call him out in class for mistakes. Ive heard office hours can help unless he thinks youre there to argue for points. Tough and inconsistent grading. Do not take unless desperate, if you do prepare to teach yourself. Only passed cause he curved.
Went to take the final and the professor never showed up. I also feel like I self taught a lot of the material throughout the course.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Please don't do it to yourself. Very unclear grading, homework weighted differently with no reasoning, changed the grading scale from the syllabus without updating the syllabus. Stay away.

yeah. those ratings are correct. Terrible teacher. terrible doctor... how did he get a doctorate? He works with you on nothing. He will not follow the rubric in terms of grading. he does not tell you what the quizzes are about so more than half the class gets 0-20%. will not help you with grade at all. piss poor, fire him. did not deserve an F...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I agree with a lot that has been said here; he won't actually answer student questions, and incorrectly teaches some principles. Partial grading on 3 question exams has no rhyme or reason. Gave quizzes every week and would tell us to study "this" for the quizzes, and then would change it out of spite for students leaving an 8pm class early. AVOID.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty darn bad. He reads straight from slides, more than once he was blatantly teaching something incorrectly, so why even bother listening? Had to teach myself everything. On top of that he does not go out of his way to help students out. The class itself wasn't that bad, online resources are incredible these days...
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hes alright. There was some confusion when he did examples on the board, but overall he wasn't that bad. He told us exactly what would be on the exam.
Never again. I have taught myself everything. He doesnt understand the material at all and should not be teaching.
Biggest mistake of my college career.

When it comes to his grading style, it is unclear of what he is looking for. You could miss a tiny detail in a question and get no credit. His handwriting and organizational skills need major work and he does not explain things in multiple ways. When there is a question, he often gives no explanation and no time to explain confusions in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor is one of the worst I have taken. He does not understand what he is teaching so he can barely explain it to those he is trying to teaching. If you question what he is saying, he just says you are wrong or "you've had issues with this". Handwriting is illegible and incredibly unorganized. Please avoid the headache at all costs!!
He doesn't understand the material and has a hard time conveying it to the student body as well he is a very particular professor on the way things are done which in turn highly impacts your grade!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader
